channel.title: Windows 8 and Gaming question
channel.description:
So I got a new computer(finally..) today. I have downloaded some games online such as Tera, Star Wars, Need for Speed, World of Warcraft, and Marvel Heroes.
All of these games are saying that my "connection has been lost" or something of a similar issue. It isn't the internet connection cause I am right by the router/able to go to other sites easily.
From what I gather this is a major current issue in the Windows 8 forums? So is there a "cheap fix" for this or something? I'd very much like to test the power of my new pc.

item.title: Windows 8 and Gaming question
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:2, topic:529343”]When you say you ‘downloaded’ some games, are they genuine copies? I know that in the past I’ve used a cracked need for speed and it had exactly the same message.

Can’t say I’ve had a single problem with my Windows 8 machine and gaming, I’ve had it installed for well over a year now.[/quote]these are the clients directly from the respective sites

I will download hypercam and try to make a video for it tonight ( want to test the video processing anyway )

In the mean time if anybody has any other solutions please do post as I can’t really do much in the mean time.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows 8 and Gaming question
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

When you say you ‘downloaded’ some games, are they genuine copies? I know that in the past I’ve used a cracked need for speed and it had exactly the same message.

Can’t say I’ve had a single problem with my Windows 8 machine and gaming, I’ve had it installed for well over a year now.

Read full topic
